description: From Middle English marle, from Old French marle, from Late Latin margila, diminutive of marga (“marl”).

entries.meaning: A mixed earthy substance, consisting of carbonate of lime, clay, and possibly sand, in very variable proportions, and accordingly designated as calcareous, clayey, or sandy.

verbs.description: marl (third-person singular simple present marls, present participle marling, simple past and past participle marled)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cover with the earthy substance called marl.

verbs.description: marl (third-person singular simple present marls, present participle marling, simple past and past participle marled)

entries.meaning: (nautical) To cover, as part of a rope, with marline, marking a peculiar hitch at each turn to prevent unwinding.
